Package laazotea.indi.server

Provides the classes necessary to create INDI Servers and a basic but functional Server.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractINDIServer
    A class representing a INDI Server.
    DefaultINDIServer
    A class representing a default implementation of an INDI Server.
    DevicePropertyBLOBEnableTuple
    A class that represents a tuple of Device and Property names and a BLOBEnable.
    INDIClient
    A class to represent a Client that connects to the Server.
    INDIDevice
    A class that represents a generic INDI Device to which the server connects and parses its messages.
    INDIDeviceListener
    A class that represents a listener to devices.
    INDIJavaDevice
    A class that represent a Java Device (created with the INDI Driver library).
    INDINativeDevice
    A class that represent a Native Device (created with the usual INDI library).
    INDINetworkDevice
    A class that represent a Network Device (another INDI server).

Package laazotea.indi.server Description

Provides the classes necessary to create INDI Servers and a basic but functional Server.

Usually a INDI Server inherits from INDIServer and implements its abstract methods. In those methods additional filtering can be done to avoid some messages arriving to some Devices or Clients. Thus, it is possible to create filering and security mechanisms.

Please check laazotea.indi.server.INDIBasicServer for a functional example of an INDI Server.

To launch the basic Server just:

> java -jar JavaINDIServer.jar [port]

More info at the INDI for Java Website.
